title: List of Phi Beta Sigma brothers
data: Former CEO and President of the Thurgood Marshall College Fund
Attorney ; motivational speaker ; host of the nationally syndicated Warren Ballentine Show ; host of Court Radio on XM Satellite Radio
Deputy Director of the Democratic Party
Civil Rights leader active in the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee and the Black Panther Party
Member of Parliament and Minister of Immigration , Labour and Training of the Commonwealth of The Bahamas
Mu Theta Chapter ( Univ. , of Kentucky )

22nd African-American to win the Pulitzer Prize ; the only African-American to win the Pulitzer at The Wall Street Journal ; host of Your Voice with Angelo Henderson on Newstalk AM 1200 and 99.9FM in Detroit
One of the twenty-nine founders of the Niagara movement , the forerunner of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People

Father of the esteemed Holloman Family and pastor of the Second Baptist Church of Washington from 1917-1970 ; Father of late Majorie Holloman Parker , National Historian Emeritus , Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority
Alpha Delta ( City College Of New York )
First black borough President of Manhattan New York
Religious leader and former president of the six-million-member National Baptist Convention , USA , Inc. ( largest black organization in the world )
Speaker of the House of Assembly and Member of Parliament , The Bahamas
Organizer , Million Man March and former President of the NAACP
Bahamas Member of Parliament , Minister of State for Works

Dean of the Terrell School of Law , 1964 Republican National Convention Delegate to San Francisco , who on National TV , publicly challenged Presidential Candidate Barry Goldwater on his record for civil rights , Past National President of Phi Beta Sigma
Cardinal Bishop , Church of God and Saints of Christ
Founder , Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters , primary organizer of the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom in Washington , D.C
First native Governor-General of Barbados , knighted by the Queen of England in 1967
Civil rights activist , Baptist minister , radio talk show host of Keepin It Real with Al Sharpton , founder of National Action Network , candidate for the 2004 U.S. Presidential election
